CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 15, 1941, pg. 3, reads: "Is The Customer Always Right?....Pittsburgh Waitresses Reveal Some Of The Problems They Confront - Business Ethics Demand That Waitresses Reveal SOme Of The Problems They Confront - Business Ethics Demand That Waitresses Please and Pamper Customers...But It Isn't Always Easy!....In No. 3. Elizabeth "Mickey" Quarrels proves she is a good waitress by smiling at two customers flirting with her. She must not show she resents what they say.  Sometimes customers go so far as to put hands on waitresses.  Drunks are an everyday problem....Photos by Harris"
TitMainTitle: Waitress Elizabeth "Mickey" Quarrels, talking to two men in booth, in Crawford Grill No. 1
